summary: This is a letter motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys, Cohen & Gresser LLP, to Judge Alison J. Nathan. The motion requests two forms of relief: (1) an order compelling the government to disclose the identities of the three alleged victims (Victims 1-3) referenced in the indictment to the defense, and (2) an order directing the Bureau of Prisons to improve Maxwell's conditions of confinement at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) and her access to discovery materials to prepare her defense.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client of the law firm filing the motion; she is the accused in the criminal case and is currently detained at the MDC.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case to whom the letter motion is addressed.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP who is representing Ghislaine Maxwell; his name is on the letterhead and he is a signatory.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP who is representing Ghislaine Maxwell; he is a signatory of the letter motion.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the 'central figure' alleged to have engaged in misconduct with many victims; his prior arrest, detention, and death are cited as context for Maxwell's current detention conditions.

connections.description: The document references Epstein as the 'central figure' and Maxwell as a co-defendant in the broader case, with both alleged to have engaged in misconduct with victims.
Mark S. Cohen is a defense attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP filing this motion on behalf of client Ghislaine Maxwell.
Christian R. Everdell is a defense attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP filing this motion on behalf of client Ghislaine Maxwell.
Both are attorneys at Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell and are signatories to the motion.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on criminal charges.

events.title: Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: Maxwell's arraignment and bail hearing were held, during which the government indicated it would begin discovery production after a protective order was entered.

events.title: Protective Order Entered
events.description: The court entered a protective order governing the handling of discovery materials.

events.title: Initial Discovery Production
events.description: The government made its first production of Rule 16 discovery materials, totaling nearly 13,000 pages.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Arrested
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and detained at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on sex trafficking charges.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's body was discovered in his cell at the MCC.

locations: United States Courthouse, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The defense argues it cannot prepare a fair defense without knowing the identities of the three alleged victims (Victims 1-3) referenced in the indictment, as the alleged misconduct occurred roughly 25 years ago in multiple locations.

The government refused to disclose victim identities, stating it would only do so through Rule 16 discovery or Jencks Act material closer to trial, despite the court's protective order being in place.

Ghislaine Maxwell's conditions of confinement at the MDC are described as uniquely onerous, including 24-hour surveillance, extended solitary confinement beyond COVID-19 quarantine, and severely limited access to discovery materials.
The defense claims Maxwell's harsh treatment is a reaction to the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's pretrial detention and death in August 2019.

The defense requests Maxwell be released to the general population and be granted significantly increased computer access to review voluminous discovery, estimating that at the current proposed rate of 3 hours per day, reviewing just the first 13,000-page production would take until mid-November 2020.
